summary: FBI interview with inmate Edward Jimenez conducted on August 16, 2019, regarding his observations in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the nights of August 9-10, 2019, surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. Jimenez describes the guards on duty and his recollection of events leading up to Epstein being found unresponsive.

persons.name: Edward Jimenez
persons.context: Inmate housed in the Special Housing Unit at MCC who was interviewed by FBI agents about his observations on the nights of August 9-10, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate who was housed in the Special Housing Unit at MCC; subject of Jimenez's observations regarding his condition and removal from his cell.

connections.description: Jimenez was an inmate housed in the same Special Housing Unit tier as Epstein and provided observations about Epstein's activities and condition to FBI investigators.

events.title: Evening in SHU before Epstein's death
events.description: Edward Jimenez was awake in his cell on L-tier, listening to the radio, and observed guards making rounds. Food was brought to Epstein's cell, and Jimenez believes Epstein's roommate was not present.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive
events.description: Jimenez woke around 6am and heard a male voice possibly saying 'breathe.' He later saw Epstein on a stretcher being taken out of his cell, with his eyes closed.

events.title: FBI interview of Edward Jimenez
events.description: FBI Special Agents and an OIG Investigator interviewed inmate Edward Jimenez at the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding his observations on August 9-10, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
keyFacts: Inmate Edward Jimenez was housed in cell #215 on L-tier of the Special Housing Unit at MCC during the nights of August 9-10, 2019.
Jimenez reported that on the evening of August 9, food was brought to Epstein's cell and he believes Epstein's roommate was not present that night.
Jimenez woke around 6am on August 10 and heard a male voice possibly saying 'breathe,' and later saw Epstein on a stretcher being removed from his cell with his eyes closed.
Jimenez described the guards on duty that night as a small, chubby woman he recognized from SHU and a black male with a medium build, both usual workers in SHU.
The FBI interview was conducted on August 16, 2019, as part of the investigation into Epstein's death.
